title: Why is Russia’s bridge to Crimea so important?
description: Ukrainian forces on Monday struck the Crimean Bridge, a key link that connects mainland Russia to Crimea, which Russia illegally annexed in 2014.

title: Biden invites Netanyahu to meet in U.S. amid rift over judicial changes
description: It was the first such invitation from Biden since Netanyahu was sworn in for his sixth term in December.

title: Accused of terrorism, soccer player is ‘a free man’ but still in limbo
description: Nizar Trabelsi was acquitted of terrorism charges but now has to fight in immigration court over where he should be released.

title: Air quality warnings return in U.S. as Canada deploys troops for wildfires
description: New York, Kentucky, Ohio and other states warned of hazardous air from wildfire smoke. Canada is deploying its Armed Forces and Coast Guard to help British Columbia.

title: Iran’s morality police resume hijab patrols after reprieve during protests
description: The police unit, responsible for enforcing Iran’s strict dress code, appeased to ease patrols amid mass protests after Mahsa Amini’s death.

title: In photos: 13 found dead in flooded tunnel as South Korean storm toll rises to at least 40
description: Thirteen bodies were recovered from a tunnel in South Korea as the flooding death toll across the country rose to at least 40.

title: Ukraine hits Crimean Bridge, but railway undamaged; Russia halts grain deal
description: A Ukrainian official said Kyiv's special forces directed the strike on the bridge, which is used by Moscow to funnel troops and weapons to its war in Ukraine.

title: An Arctic ‘Great Game’ as NATO allies and Russia face off in far north
description: The war in Ukraine has put the frostbitten borderlands between Norway and Russia on heightened alert, while increasing the geostrategic importance of the Arctic.

title: John Kerry hails China’s ‘incredible’ renewables, warns against coal
description: The American climate envoy is in Beijing for talks with his Chinese counterpart about what the world's two biggest polluters can do.

title: 13 found dead in flooded tunnel as South Korean storm toll rises to 40
description: Water swept into an underpass near Cheongju and flooded vehicles including a bus, authorities said, as the country grapples with continuing heavy rain.

title: Ukraine live briefing: ‘Emergency’ on key Crimean bridge; hours remain before grain deal expires
description: Food security for millions of people is on the line as the Black Sea grain deal approaches its deadline. Lower-income countries would suffer the most if it expires.

title: Global hunger enters a grim ‘new normal’
description: This year’s U.N. report on global food security points to a world where hundreds of millions of people face hunger, deepened by the ravages of climate change and regional economic turmoil.

title: Australia’s Matildas call for equal FIFA prize money ahead of World Cup
description: The 2023 Women’s World Cup prize money sits at $110 million, compared with $440 million for the 2022 men’s tournament in Qatar.

title: Extreme weather threatens the best-kept art of the ancient Silk Road
description: Buddhist cave paintings in the Gobi Desert in western China are at risk from heavy rainfall and flash floods as weather becomes more extreme, Greenpeace says.
